title: Generate home page from home.md instead of static HTML
description:
## Problem
Currently the home page content is duplicated:
- `content/home.md` has markdown content (editable, versioned)
- `index.html` has static HTML (must be manually kept in sync)

This causes issues when updating content - changes to home.md don't appear on the site.

## Desired State
- `home.md` is the single source of truth for home page content
- `index.html` provides the shell/structure only
- Content is rendered dynamically (like persona/capability pages) OR generated at build time
- Current visual formatting/styling is preserved

## Current Architecture
- `build.js` parses home.md → stores in data.js as `home.content`
- `app.js` renders persona/capability pages dynamically from data.js
- Home page (`#home`) is static HTML in index.html, not rendered from data.js

## Options

### Option A: Runtime rendering (like personas)
- app.js renders home content from data.js when navigating to #home
- Consistent with how other pages work
- Requires markdown-to-HTML conversion in browser (or pre-convert in build.js)

### Option B: Build-time generation
- build.js generates the home section HTML
- Inject into index.html or a separate file
- More complex build process

## Mapping Challenge
home.md has sections like:
- "How to Read These Expectations"
- "What We Value" (with subsections)
- "How to Use This Framework"
- "How the Capability Areas Work Together"
- "Key Truths"
- etc.

These need to map to styled HTML with appropriate CSS classes (balance-section, value cards, etc.)

## Acceptance Criteria
1. Editing home.md updates the home page after rebuild
2. Current visual design is preserved
3. No manual sync between home.md and index.html required

## Files Involved
- `content/home.md` - source content
- `build.js` - may need to parse home.md differently
- `app.js` - may need to render home page dynamically
- `index.html` - home section becomes a shell or is generated
- `data.js` - may need richer home content structure
close_reason: Implemented: Home page now rendered dynamically from home.md

title: Add GitHub Actions workflow to build data.js and deploy to Pages
description:
data.js is generated by build.js but currently committed to git. This creates duplication (content exists in both markdown files and data.js) and risks stale builds if someone forgets to regenerate.

Solution:
1. Add GitHub Actions workflow that runs 'node build.js' on push
2. Deploy generated files to GitHub Pages
3. Add data.js to .gitignore
4. Remove data.js from git tracking

This ensures the site always reflects the latest content without manual build steps.
